definitions.definition: To deliver , especially in context of sin or relevant penalties.
To pay a price to set someone free from captivity or punishment .
examples: to ransom prisoners from an enemy

definitions.definition: To exact a ransom (payment) in exchange for the freedom of.

main_definition: ( obsolete ) To deliver , especially in context of sin or relevant penalties. [14th century]
